content: stargirl bralette by uma knits @uma knits the stargirl bralette is a simple and super quick bottom-up knit that is completely customizable you can knit it with any yarn and needles and you can make it as long or as cropped as you d like you have the choice to add on embroidered stars at the end this pattern is meant to be a very basic tutorial for knitting this garment shape laying out the steps i took to make this piece you may need to modify slightly to make the bralette that is perfect for you sample knit with hipknitshop fluff 1 yarn notes & resources you can use any yarn for this knit since you will be coming up with the measurements yourself construction this bralette is knit in the round from the bottom up you will knit the body then cast off the back and materials knit the front flat you ll finish off with i-cord straps for the body any circular knitting needles that give you a tight enough gauge for coverage 24 cable i-cord an i-cord is a simple knitted tube that we will use for for the ribbing circular knitting needles 2mm smaller than the straps in this pattern it is knit in the round on two double- the body needles 24 cable pointed needles when you transfer your 3 stitches to the dpns same size as body needles 2 dpn you will knit them as you normally do then slide the stitch markers three stitches down the needle from left to right and transfer measuring tape your needle to your left hand without turning it your working darning needle yarn is now coming from the far left stitch pull the yarn snug scrap yarn for embroidery then knit the 3 stitches from the left to right needle just like embroidery needle normal the only difference is that your yarn is coming from the opposite end of your active stitches continue to knit slide techniques the stitches down the needle and switch the needle into your knitting in the round left hand to create the tube 1x1 rib stockinette stitch star embroidery adding some embroidered stars is decreases - ssk & k2tog completely up to you but does give this bralette some i-cord ~twinkle~ you can follow my instructions at the end or come up with your own stars feel free to get creative here 2 abbreviations k = knit p = purl rs = right side ws = 5 take the number of sts per inch calculation #2 and wrong side st st = stockinette stitch sts = stitches stm = multiply by the final circumference calculation #4 stitch marker pm = place stitch marker bobble = bind off ssk = slip two stitches knitwise then knit these two stitches together this is the number of sts you will cast on by inserting your left needle through the front of the two slipped sts and wrapping your yarn around the right needle 6
